text.section: Zoning regulations and boundaries may be amended or repealed.

section.section:
The legislative body may grant the amendment to change the zoning classification based on a finding that there was:
a substantial change in the character of the neighborhood where the property is located; or
a mistake in the existing zoning classification.
The legislative body shall keep a complete record of a hearing on an application for reclassification and the votes of the members of the legislative body.

A legislative body may not allow the filing of an application for a reclassification of all or part of any land for which a reclassification has been denied by the legislative body on the merits in the 12 months before the date of the application.
The provisions of § 4-203(b) of this subtitle concerning public hearings and notice apply to applications for reclassification.
